projectDesc.p: To the tune “Always Encountering Joy”—"The Bright Moon is Like Frost" is part of The Global Medieval Sourcebook, a digital compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. This larger project comprises computer-readable transcriptions and/or editions of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century, and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia; accompanied by new English translations; high-resolution digital images of manuscript/early print sources, where available; an apparatus that includes critical introductions, textual notes and annotations; and a flexible user interface with which to navigate these materials.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: To the tune “Always Encountering Joy”—"The Bright Moon is Like Frost"
The moon shines so brightly that it looks like frost covers the ground,
The autumn wind is cool like water,
The pure view of autumn is boundless.
In the winding pond, fish jump;
Dew drops fall from the round lotus leaves.
No one notices the stillness.
Bum and brum, the drum of midnight,
Loud and clear, a leaf falls.
In the darkness, my dream of cloud is abruptly cut short.
The night is vast and obscure,
Nowhere could I find the happiness and sorrow in my life again.
Woken up, I walk around in the small garden.
I am an exhausted traveler at the edge of the world,
Longing to return to the mountains.
I stare in the direction of my hometown yet it is so far away that my eyes wear out.
The Swallow Tower is empty.
Where is the fair one?
The swallow is locked in the empty tower.
The past and the present are like dreams;
when do we ever wake up from them?
There is just old love and new regrets.
In some future time,
In the night scene of the Yellow Tower,
I hope that someone will utter a long sigh for me.
